Description: Glazed composition (faience) amuletic figure of Anubis; mould-made and covered in a blue-green glaze; jackal-headed human standing on a low plinth, with arms down by the side; perforated for suspension through the middle back; figure is chipped and surface is worn.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Bibliographic references: Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.117, Tomb 31)
